title: Base functions
code: library(echos)

title: Base functions
text: first example, want model well-known AirPassengers time series (ts object). dataset contains monthly totals international airline passengers (thousands) January 1949 December 1960 144 observations total. first 132 observations used model training (n_train) last 12 observations used testing (n_ahead). xtrain xtest numeric vectors containing training testing data.

title: Base functions
text: function train_esn() used automatically train ESN input data xtrain, output xmodel object class esn. object xmodel list containing actual fitted values, residuals, internal states states_train, estimated coefficients ridge regression estimation, hyperparameters, etc. can summarize model using generic S3 method summary() get detailed information trained model. output , get following information trained ESN model:

title: Base functions
text: function forecast_esn() used forecast trained model xmodel n_ahead steps future. output xfcst list class forecast_esn containing point forecasts, actual fitted values, forecast horizon n_ahead model specification model_spec. can use generic S3 method plot() visualize point forecast within xfcst add holdout test data xtest.

title: Base functions
text: now call function tune_esn() evaluate grid hyperparameter values. example, test different values leakage rate alpha conduct time series cross-validation. , n_ahead = 12 produces 12-step-ahead forecasts, n_split = 5 creates five rolling train/test splits. split hyperparameter combination, model fitted training window evaluated subsequent test window. S3 method summary() reports best hyperparameter set according default accuracy metric (MSE unless specify metric = "mae"), along corresponding performance. plot() visualizes actual data together point forecasts selected “best” configuration. Forecasts drawn separate line segments test window, vertical dashed lines indicate test window begins, making easy see performance varies across splits.
code: # Tune hyperparameters via time series cross-validation xfit <- tune_esn(   y = xdata,   n_ahead = 12,   n_split = 5,   alpha = seq(0.1, 1.0, 0.1),   rho   = c(1.0),   tau   = c(0.4) )  # Summarize and visualize optimal hyperparameter configuration summary(xfit) #> # A tibble: 5 × 11 #>   alpha   rho   tau split train_start train_end test_start test_end   mse   mae #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int>       <int>     <int>      <int>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     1   0.4     1           1        84         85       96  471.  19.5 #> 2     1     1   0.4     2           1        96         97      108  376.  14.2 #> 3     1     1   0.4     3           1       108        109      120  526.  19.0 #> 4     1     1   0.4     4           1       120        121      132  547.  20.2 #> 5     1     1   0.4     5           1       132        133      144  396.  17.0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: id <int> plot(xfit)

title: Tidy functions
text: function ESN() used combination model() fabletools package train Echo State Network variable value. trained models stored mable (.e., model table). Additionally, ARIMA() model trained benchmark.

what: Echo State Networks for Time Series Modeling and Forecasting
title: Echo State Networks for Time Series Modeling and Forecasting
text: echos package provides comprehensive set functions methods modeling forecasting univariate time series using Echo State Networks (ESNs). offers two alternative approaches: Base R interface: Functions modeling forecasting time series using numeric vectors, allowing straightforward integration existing R workflows. Tidy interface: seamless integration fable framework based tsibble, enabling tidy time series forecasting model evaluation. interface leverages fabletools package, providing consistent streamlined workflow model development, evaluation, visualization. package features lightweight implementation enables fast fully automatic model training forecasting using ESNs. can quickly easily build accurate ESN models without requiring extensive hyperparameter tuning manual configuration.

title: Echo State Networks for Time Series Modeling and Forecasting
text: can install stable version CRAN: can install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("echos") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ahaeusser/echos")

title: Echo State Networks for Time Series Modeling and Forecasting
code: library(echos)  # Forecast horizon n_ahead <- 12 # forecast horizon # Number of observations n_obs <- length(AirPassengers) # Number of observations for training n_train <- n_obs - n_ahead  # Prepare train and test data xtrain <- AirPassengers[(1:n_train)] xtest <- AirPassengers[((n_train+1):n_obs)]  # Train and forecast ESN model xmodel <- train_esn(y = xtrain) xfcst <- forecast_esn(xmodel, n_ahead = n_ahead)  # Plot result plot(xfcst, test = xtest)

title: Echo State Networks for Time Series Modeling and Forecasting
code: library(echos) library(tidyverse) library(tsibble) library(fable)  # Prepare train data train_frame <- m4_data %>%   filter(series %in% c("M21655", "M2717"))  # Train and forecast ESN model train_frame %>%   model(     "ESN" = ESN(value),     "ARIMA" = ARIMA(value)     ) %>%   forecast(h = 18) %>%   autoplot(train_frame, level = NULL)

what: Train an Echo State Network — train_esn
title: Train an Echo State Network — train_esn
text: Train Echo State Network (ESN) univariate time series.    function automatically manages data pre-processing, reservoir    generation (.e., internal states) model estimation selection.

title: Train an Echo State Network — train_esn
code: train_esn(   y,   lags = 1,   inf_crit = "bic",   n_diff = NULL,   n_states = NULL,   n_models = NULL,   n_initial = NULL,   n_seed = 42,   alpha = 1,   rho = 1,   tau = 0.4,   density = 0.5,   lambda = c(1e-04, 2),   scale_win = 0.5,   scale_wres = 0.5,   scale_inputs = c(-0.5, 0.5) )

title: Train an Echo State Network — train_esn
text: y Numeric vector containing response variable (missing values). lags Integer vector lag(s) associated input variable. inf_crit Character value. Information criterion used model selection among n_models candidate ridge fits (different random lambda values). candidate smallest criterion value selected. One c("aic", "aicc", "bic", "hqc"). n_diff Integer value. nth-differences response variable. n_diff = NULL, number differences required achieve stationarity determined automatically via KPSS-test. n_states Integer value. number internal states reservoir. n_states = NULL, reservoir size determined min(floor(n_total * tau), 200), n_total time series length. n_models Integer value. maximum number (random) models train model selection. n_models = NULL, number models defined n_states*2. n_initial Integer value. number observations internal states initial drop (throw-). n_initial = NULL, throw-defined n_total*0.05, n_total time series length. n_seed Integer value. seed random number generator (reproducibility). alpha Numeric value. leakage rate (smoothing parameter) applied reservoir (value greater 0 less equal 1). rho Numeric value. spectral radius scaling reservoir weight matrix (value often 0 1, values 1 possible). tau Numeric value. reservoir scaling parameter determine reservoir size based time series length (value greater 0 less equal 1). density Numeric value. connectivity reservoir weight matrix (dense sparse) (value greater 0 less equal 1). lambda Numeric vector. Lower upper bound lambda range ridge regression (numeric vector length 2 values greater 0 lambda[1] < lambda[2]). scale_win Numeric value. lower upper bound uniform distribution scaling input weight matrix (value greater 0, weights sampled U(-scale_win, scale_win)). scale_wres Numeric value. lower upper bound uniform distribution scaling reservoir weight matrix (value greater 0, weights sampled U(-scale_wres, scale_wres) applying rho density). scale_inputs Numeric vector. lower upper bound scaling time series data (numeric vector length 2 scale_inputs[1] < scale_inputs[2], often symmetric, e.g., c(-0.5, 0.5) c(-1, 1)).

title: Train an Echo State Network — train_esn
